oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Electrical conductivity studies on the plasticised PEO-DBP-CdX (X=Cl; SO4) polymer electrolytes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MITRA, S
KULKARNI, AR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: poly(ethylene oxide)
polymer electrolytes
plasticisers
dibuytl phthalate
electrical conductivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Polymer electrolytes in the ternary PEO-CdSO4-DBP and PEO-CdCl2-DBP systems have been synthesized using solution casting technique. The resulting polymer electrolyte films are translucent, bubble-free and mechanically flexible. The ternary polymers have been characterized using FTIR spectroscopy, optical microscopy, SEM and DSC techniques. The electrical conductivity of PEO-CdSO4-DBP and PEO-CdCl2-DBP systems at room temperature are at least 10 times higher compared to the corresponding nonplasticized binary systems. The room temperature conductivity changes by an order of 10(-9) S cm(-1) for nonplasticized PEO-CdSO4 to 1.45x10(-8) S cm(-1) with 48.22 wt.% DBP. For PEO-CdCl2 system, room temperature conductivity changes from an order of 10(-9)-2.06x10(-8) S cm(-1) with 42.58 wt% DBP. The conductivity is found to depend on the concentration of the DBP. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: International Conference on Solid State Ionics,CAIRNS, AUSTRALIA,JUL 08-13, 2001
